name: GJ 3634
scenarioDescription:
The GJ 3634 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 3634 is a star with 0.45 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.43 times its radius. It is located 64.57888799999999 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 5 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

GJ 3634 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 3634 system

GJ 3634 b

GJ 3634 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory using the Radial Velocity method. The mass of GJ 3634 b is 8.4 times the mass of Earth. At 8.4 Earth masses, GJ 3634 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system GJ 3634, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by La Silla Observatory.
